hero.title: What is Ojo Perezoso and how it works
hero.description: An innovative solution based on scientific evidence to correct amblyopia (lazy eye) through visual exercises assisted by artificial intelligence.

lazyEye.title: What is a lazy eye?
lazyEye.description1: Amblyopia, commonly known as "lazy eye", is an eye condition that affects approximately 3% of the world's population. It develops during childhood when the brain and one eye don't work together properly.
lazyEye.description2: In this condition, the brain favors one eye over the other, which can cause vision problems in the less-used eye. Over time, the "lazy" eye can develop reduced vision if not properly treated.
lazyEye.description3: Although amblyopia is primarily diagnosed in childhood, recent studies show that the adult brain retains the plasticity necessary to improve visual function through specific exercises.
symptomsList: Eyes that don't appear to work together
Head tilting or closing one eye

steps.title: Precise Detection
steps.description: The application uses the front camera to track your eyes in real-time, monitoring their movement and coordination.

steps.title: Guided Exercises
steps.description: Follow specific visual targets designed to strengthen the weaker eye and improve binocular coordination.

steps.title: Progress Tracking
steps.description: The application monitors and records your progress, adjusting the difficulty of exercises to optimize results.

science.title: Scientific Background
science.paragraph1: Ojo Perezoso is based on recent scientific studies that demonstrate the effectiveness of visual exercises for amblyopia. Research shows that visual training can improve visual acuity, contrast sensitivity, and binocular function.
science.paragraph2: The human brain maintains significant neuroplasticity even in adulthood, allowing the neural connections responsible for vision to reorganize and strengthen with proper training.
benefitsList: Stimulate the use of the affected eye
Train the brain to correctly process signals from both eyes
science.note: Note: Although Ojo Perezoso can be an effective tool to complement amblyopia treatment, we always recommend consulting with an ophthalmologist or optometrist for professional diagnosis and treatment.

usage.title: Recommended Usage
usage.intro: To get the best results with Ojo Perezoso, we recommend following these guidelines:

recommendations.title: Daily Sessions
recommendations.description: Perform exercises for 5-10 minutes, at least once a day.

recommendations.title: Suitable Environment
recommendations.description: Use the application in a well-lit space, free from distractions.

recommendations.title: Correct Position
recommendations.description: Maintain a comfortable distance from the screen (approximately 40-50 cm).

recommendations.title: Gradual Progression
recommendations.description: Start with short sessions and gradually increase the duration as you feel more comfortable.

recommendations.title: Necessary Breaks
recommendations.description: If you experience visual fatigue, take a break. Overexertion can be counterproductive.

usage.important: Important: Consistency is key to success. Results may vary depending on the severity of amblyopia and the user's age, but most people begin to notice improvements after 4-6 weeks of regular use.

instructions.title: Exercise Instructions
steps: Keep your head stable and at a comfortable distance from the screen.
Follow the visual targets that will appear on screen with both eyes.
Complete the 5-minute session for best results.
